name: Moldova
takeaway: The Republic of Moldova is a country of low pressure and low interest for Beijing. Those parties and political actors in Chişinău which are pro-Kremlin tend also to be pro-Beijing, but this is only because of their general anti-Western attitude.
In business, no major investments or participation in public tenders by PRC actors have taken place. The most important presence is in renewable energy, with a couple of small-size solar stations.

A few universities host small cooperation programs with Chinese peers, mostly in agro-sciences and medicine. A government minister visited Beijing in 2023 with a mandate to encourage tourism and the exports of wine, but the impact of such initiatives is likely to remain limited.
description-1: In 2023, Moldova had a GDP per capita of US$6,651 and a total population of 3.08 million people.
description-2: Moldova established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1992. Moldova was ranked 31st in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 61/100.

Media.evidence: No such evidence could be found, on a media market which is tiny and contracting anyway. There is not much interest in Beijing to invest resources and effort in an audience which is dominated by the Russian-speaking media
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: We could not find info on the official list of BRNN, but a story from 2019 names Infotag director Alexandru Tanas among the participants in BRNN workshop in the PRC. Infotag is also the platform where the PRC Ambassador in Moldova publishes his occasional op-eds. Also Anatol Caciuc, employee of the Moldova National Radio, is a collaborator of China Radio International
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: Yes, before the Covid crisis: a BRNN workshop for journalists, including the director of a Moldovan news agency. The participants visited different regions of the PRC.  To quote: „In just two weeks, the participants were divided into two teams and visited different parts of China separately. They saw, heard and felt on their journey, recording Chinese stories and getting a taste of China's colorful culture. “Seeing is believing. We have seen a prosperous China,” noted Alexandru Tanas, Director-General of Moldova’s News Agency Infotag”. We considered this evidence of a paid media tour in PRC.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: No data found for the period of interest
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: The problems exists, but only in relation to the free / cheap content provided by Russia. There were instances when PRC media reported positively about Moldova (see link) and this fact was mentioned on Moldovan media websites, but only marginally
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: The market is not big and attractive enough for this type of political advertising effort
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: We found no reports about Moldovan journalists being pressured by the PRC in any way. Moldovan media does not pay a lot of attention to China, so this kind of thing is unlikely to happen. The Freedom House report on media freedom in Moldova also found no such cases
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: There is no consistent interest for, and coverage of the PRC in the Moldovan media for such episodes to happen
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: The subjects hardly get on the news, so VIPs have no incentive to address them
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Moldova does have a parliamentary friendship group with the PRC, but it is not a joint one, i.e. it comprises only Moldovan MPs
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Donations to educational institutions (tablets); rehabilitation of three kindergartens. All in all, rather small and symbollic gestures, however the members of Moldovan government were present
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2021, the PRC Embassy's Economic and Commercial Office invited employees of the Moldovan State Chancellery to attend online classes on topics ranging from vaccination to various Belt and Road programmes. It was formalistic, no real impact especially since Moldova is pushing for EU accession
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Moldova has had no hostage diplomacy incidents with the PRC and seems highly unlikely to happen
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No written agreement, but a secretary general of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Moldova declared in 2023 during an event that PRC is "an important strategic partner"
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In fact it is confusing, as the wording is "one China", with no specification "principle" or "policy"
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The PRC's territorial claims are not something the Moldovan diplomacy has taken a stance on. However, the Reintegration Minister Oleg Serebrian once compared Moldova's dealings with its separatist region to the  PRC's ”reunification file”, saying ”China is a very strong country, but the problem persists”. We would consider this an isolated statement and not a indication of the government's actual stance.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Moldovan government has not publicly commented on the PRC's treatment of the Uyghur population
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Moldovan government did not express a public stance regarding the PRC's treatment of the Tibet population, at least not during the period of interest for this index
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: We found no comments from Moldovan officials concerning the imposition of the National Security Law on Hong Kong
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: The Technical University of Moldova has  in place a cooperation agreement with Huawei. It has also signed in 2023 a memorandum of cooperation with the Agricultural University of China, in the presence of the minister of Agriculture of Moldova. The State Medical University of Moldova has a common project with the Medical University of Gansu to create a Center for Traditional Chinese Medicine.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: One of the lectors at the Free University of Moldova, which hosts the Confucius Institute, also heads the Moldova-China Chamber of Commerce and Industry, with an active website. However the quality and consistency of the teaching are doubtful
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: Chinese is not included in the national school curriculum. The main foreign languages taught are English, Russian and French. While there are some culturally specialized schools, such as a Moldovan-Italian or a Moldovan-Turkish high school, there is no equivalent Moldovan-Chinese institution
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: We could not find any Moldovan institutions in the lists provided by the index authors, nor are we aware, as civil society members ourselves, of Belt and Road-affiliated think-tanks in Moldova. As for academic research centers, Moldovan academia does not play a significant role in society or in policy debates. As a result it is an unlikely target for PRC influence operations
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: Moldovan think-tanks and civil society as a whole are mostly dependent on Western donors and work with Western partners. There are some funded by Russia, but none by China, see also previous item
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: Some academic exchanges for students do take place, but they are at very low level, focusing mostly on language and with small number of participants
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: There are some PRC-funded trips to the PRC for medical staff or Confucius Institute students and staff, but the scale of these exchanges does not look like an influence operation targeting the intellectual community
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: There are no PRC-connected student groups at all, since the number of Chinese students in Moldova is insignificant
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: We could find no reports of academics being pressured because of their critical views towards the PRC
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: The Free International University of Moldova, which hosts the Confucius Institute, has some Chinese academic assistants in the Asian studies section. Their involvement in curriculum design cannot be ruled out, even though there is no clear evidence
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: No such articles could be found. The volume of scholarly publishing in Moldova is very limited and East Asian affairs are anyway not among the priority areas, impact would be non-existant
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The Moldovan capital Chisinau has cooperation agreements with Xi'an, Beijing, Qingdao and Chongqing. They were not very consequential in practice, however.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There are other municipalities in Moldova that have twinning or cooperation agreements with PRC cities such as Bălţi, Moldova's second largest city. The government is not collecting this information because it does not considered important
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The link leads to an official statement from the Party of Socialists about a visit to PRC and about their cooperation the Chinese Communist Party. In 2023 civil servants from Chisinau local government attended workshops in China sponsored by the PRC ministry of Commerce
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The last official visit by members of the Parliament was in 2019, before the start of the pandemic. Since then, members of the Moldovan Socialist Party (pro-Kremlin) have attended online events and kept making pro-China public statements. More recently, in 2023, the Minister of Culture of Moldova paid a visit to China where he met his counterpart and signed a Cooperation Agreement between the two ministries in areas of tourism and patrimony. Also in 2023 the Minister of Agriculture of Moldova (and deputy prime minister) visited China and signed a memorandum with his Chinese counterpart on the development of the wine sector
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The vice-president of the Moldovan parliament visited Beijing and had meetings at the top level with CCP officials.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Moldovan legislation bans the financing of parties and electoral candidates by foreign entities. The electoral authority did not report any violations of this law by PRC-connected entities. Journalistic investigations have only revealed hidden money flows from Russia to Moldova pro-Russian parties, but nothing about the PRC
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: We could not identify any UFWD-linked groups in Moldova
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: No such actions by PRC against Moldovan politicians
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In general the pro-Moscow political groups who do this. For instance the pro-Russian Socialists has been friendly to the PRC and hint at the superiority of their system and PRC's development success. The vice-president of the Moldovan Parliament, Vlad Bătrâncea (Socialists) is an active promoter of the PRC, which he visits increasingly often
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: No such evidence could be found; probably the interest in Moldova is not high enough
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Certain parties and politicians are inclined to praise PRC, but they cannot suppress criticism of it coming from other quarters
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: No, but it is coming as a close 3rd in terms of imports into Moldova
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: Moldova does not own money to the PRC under bilateral agreements
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: According to a 2019 report, 98% of Moldova's extractive industry production was consumed on the domestic market. The country does not have natural resources that would be of interest for the PRC
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: The PRC has invested in some projects, such as a small photovoltaic farm in Moldova, but the scale of these investments is insignificant. There was discussion at some point about larger infrastructure projects, but several governments have changed in Moldova since then and the projects nothing materialized
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: Moldova is listed neither among current, nor among prospective members of AIIB
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: We could not find information about individual businesses. Thw Moldovan Chamber of Commerce and Industry is a member of the Silk Road Chamber of Industry and Commerce, while Moldova also has a bilateral Moldova-China Chamber of Commerce and Industry, which includes several well-known local companies and became quite active and visible lately, organising events, but with no clear impact
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: We could find no evidence of Moldovan financial institutions using CIPS
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: There are no documented cases of the PRC employing economic coercion against Moldova. There has no been no situation where such measures would make sense
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: Negotiations regarding a free trade agreement between Moldova and the PRC have been underway since 2017, but there is no finality in sight. Moldova has become an EU candidate country in 2023 and therefore is unlikely to sign any FTA with the PRC that would endanger its relations with the EU, its main partner and geostrategic anchor
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: Moldova has several free economic zones, but none of them specifically target PRC entities. The Moldovan ambassador in Beijing however continues to advertise them to PRC businesses, although the prospect is unrealistic
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence: There are no such debts to PRC entities
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: The Moldovan market is small and can accommodate only a handful of telecom operators, none of the current ones being owned by PRC entities
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: There are no such agreements with PRC providers
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: The main telecom and ISP companies widely use Huawei routers and modems
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: Huawei equipment is used for road traffic monitoring, among other things
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: During the pandemic, some institutions used Hikvisions thermal scanning video surveillance systems
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: The China Tech Map lists Huawei as having a Smart City presence in Moldova, but we could not find any further details
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: Moldova is not served by cables build by PRC entities
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: The start-up sector in Moldova is underdeveloped and likely presents no economic or strategic interest for the PRC
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: Moldova does not really have local companies working on advanced technologies like AI, blockchain or big data, that would be able to sign MOU on technological development with PRC entities
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: The only space-related experience of Moldova, from 2022, was done in cooperation with SpaceX
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: We found no evidence of Moldovan authorities endorsing the Beidou navigation system
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Society.evidence: We checked the registry of NGOs and found no such organizations
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Society.evidence: No UWCA members listed for Moldova, no other source found that this may be otherwise
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Society.evidence: we did find any information on cooperation with the ACFTU, exchanges or visits to the PRC
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Society.evidence: The Chinese diaspora in Moldova too small for such events. According to the Bureau for Migration and Asylum, there only 64 PRC citizens residing in Moldova in 2021

Society.evidence: We found no evidence of PRC-connected associations existing in Moldova

Society.evidence: We were not able to find any examples of PRC-related charity or religious donations in Moldova
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Society.evidence: In 2020, the national broadcaster hosted the Chinese Film Festival and showed the drama series Ode to Joy.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Society.evidence: TikTok is the second most popular free app in the country, and the first social network
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Society.evidence: Other theater or music companies from both sides visit the other part, but these instances are rare and without a big impact. In general, the entertainment market in Moldova is dominated by Western and Russian content
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Society.evidence: This industry is tiny and not involved in such disputes
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Society.evidence: According to a 2022 survey, 64% of respondents do not know how to rate the relations between Moldova and China, which is the closest indicator to their opinion on the PRC: lack of exposure to the topic and low interest
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Military.evidence: We found no information on recent purchases or donations, but older equipment (such as traffic surveillance) is still in use
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.
Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Military.evidence: Moldova is not ană producer and/or exporter of military or law enforcement equipment
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Military.evidence: Moldova is a neutral country and the Constitution does not allow foreign bases on Moldovan soil
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Military.evidence: Moldova received during Covid vaccines and other sanitary materials from the PRC, but there is no information about any relief effort by the PLA
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Military.evidence: As a neutral country, Moldova does not have any permanent or rotational presence of PLA troops

Military.evidence: Acording to the commanders of the Moldovan army, study grants have been offered in the past to young officers by the Chinese party, on medical and logistics specialities, but no further details are available

Military.evidence: No such evidence found and, given the China-Russia alignment oner the past two years, and Moldova's commitment to EU and NATO, such contacts are very unlinely
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Military.evidence: We found no such examples and deem them unlikely. The Moldovan army is tiny and does not present any strategic interest for the PRC
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Military.evidence: Neither current, nor former military/intelligence leaders have publicly advocated for closer cooperation with the PLA
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Military.evidence: There is no info about such cooperation which, under the current geopolitical alignment, would be practically impossible

Law Enforcement.evidence: No such agreement is listed on the Moldova MFA's PRC page or on the Prosecutor General's Office international cooperation page
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Law Enforcement.evidence: We found no such agreement listed on the websites of the relevant ministries and authorities

Law Enforcement.evidence: While we found older reports about Moldovan traffickers who smuggled drugs from China, the triads themselves are no present in Moldova, where they likely see no market for their business
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Law Enforcement.evidence: No such evidence could be found, and very unlikely to happen
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Moldova is too far away from the PRC's area of security interests. Both the Moldovan police (ref1) and the Prosecutor's Office (ref 2) publish information about their international cooperation and we found not data about PRC cooperation. The Prosecutor's Office does have a cooperation agreement with the PRC, signed in 2011
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Local criminal groups with political agenda do exist in Moldova, but they have nothing to do with the PRC and its interests
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Law Enforcement.evidence: If cyberattacks happen in Moldova, they are usually traced back to Russia or non-affiliated hackers
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Law Enforcement.evidence: The Chinese diaspora in the Republic of Moldova is negligible in size. There are no reports about such pressures exerted by the PRC
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Law Enforcement.evidence: The Chinese diaspora in the Republic of Moldova is negligible in size. There are no reports about such actions of the Moldovan authorities
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Law Enforcement.evidence: While the Moldovan government did not arrest anyone, it did eliminate Falun Gong from the registry of non-profit organizations in 2015. In 2021, the European Court of Human Rights ruled against Moldova in this case and the government re-registered Falun Dafa/Falun Gong as a legal organization
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Law Enforcement.evidence: The Ministry of Defense and several health institutions used Hikvision termovision surveillance systems. As noted above, the Moldovan police is also using PRC equipment for traffic monitoring
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.
